description: From Middle English wringere, equivalent to wring +â€Ž -er.

examples: We wringers of hands don't really want a step to take! We want to continue our hand-wringing and feel hostile toward anyone who acts as if there's something simple to do about any problem.

entries.meaning: A device for drying laundry consisting of two rollers between which the wet laundry is squeezed (or wrung); a mangle.
(figurative) Something that causes pain, hardship, or exertion; an ordeal.
